Why is increasing the area of land under cultivation NOT considered a sustainable solution for meeting the growing food demand?

options.c: It can lead to deforestation and habitat loss

question: Why is relying solely on the Green Revolution for food security NOT sustainable in the long run?

options.b: It reduces the need for irrigation
options.c: It can lead to environmental degradation

question: Why is food security dependent on both availability and access to food?

options.a: Availability is more important than access
options.b: Access is more important than availability
options.c: People need both food and money to buy it

question: How does mixed farming contribute to sustainable agriculture?

options.a: It increases reliance on chemical inputs
options.c: It integrates crop and livestock production

question: Why is genetic modification of crops a controversial topic?

options.a: It always leads to higher yields
options.b: It is always beneficial to the environment
options.c: Concerns exist about its potential impact on health and environment
options.d: It reduces the need for pesticides

question: Why is it important to consider both short-term and long-term benefits when choosing between fertilizers and manure?

options.a: Fertilizers are always better than manure
options.b: Manure is always better than fertilizers
options.c: Fertilizers provide quick results but can harm soil; manure is slower but more sustainable

question: What is the main advantage of using composite fish culture?

options.b: It uses only one species of fish
options.c: It utilizes all food resources in the pond efficiently

question: How does summer ploughing help in pest and weed control?

options.b: It exposes pests and weeds to harsh conditions
options.d: It adds nutrients to the soil

question: Why is the choice of bee variety important for honey production?

options.a: All bee varieties produce the same amount of honey
options.b: Different varieties have different honey collection capacities
options.c: Bee variety only affects the color of honey

question: Why is crop rotation considered a beneficial agricultural practice?

options.b: It increases pest and disease problems
options.c: It helps maintain soil fertility and reduces pest/disease build-up
